title.narrative: Colloquium on international law on the rights accorded to refugees’ vis-à-vis Ethiopian laws and migration policy.

description.narrative: Colloquium on international law on the rights accorded to refugees’ vis-à-vis Ethiopian laws and migration policy.
Colloquium on international law on the rights accorded to refugees’ vis-à-vis Ethiopian laws and migration policy.

comment.narrative: A total of 3600( 1500F) both from refugee and host communities get awareness on the revised refugee legislation, CRFF and 9 pledges level via the existed mini medias(information centers)

title.narrative: Workshops on legal status for refugees in regards to OCP. The national platform will: softly advocate on OCP with major stakeholders including ARRA, enable documentation of best practices on refugee law, OCP and other national laws that have the potential to reduce migration of people from host community and secondary movement of refugees, create a forum to come up with local solutions on the root causes of migration, and show how refugees can benefit the local economy by using case studies.

description.narrative: Workshops on legal status for refugees in regards to OCP. The national platform will: softly advocate on OCP with major stakeholders including ARRA, enable documentation of best practices on refugee law, OCP and other national laws that have the potential to reduce migration of people from host community and secondary movement of refugees, create a forum to come up with local solutions on the root causes of migration, and show how refugees can benefit the local economy by using case studies.

Workshops on legal status for refugees in regards to OCP. The national platform will: softly advocate on OCP with major stakeholders including ARRA, enable documentation of best practices on refugee law, OCP and other national laws that have the potential to reduce migration of people from host community and secondary movement of refugees, create a forum to come up with local solutions on the root causes of migration, and show how refugees can benefit the local economy by using case studies.

title.narrative: Organize awareness raising and campaigns for refugee and Ethiopian migrants on the realities of migration [en route and destination with special attention to youth (14-18), young women and girls] through: Seminars/platforms involving discussions for refugees and diaspora and returnees as a mean for learning and enlightenment; Interactive information and dialogue platforms using documentary video; Mass and mini media tools such as radio programmes, IEC materials migration to disseminate information to increase public awareness; Production and dissemination of magazine containing personal stories about irregular migration in different languages; Establishment and maintaining a Migration desk at the information centres (social media group, formal/informal information on migration, database of repatriates and diaspora, etc.).

title.narrative: Promote and provide skills/trainings: life skills, vocational and entrepreneurship training (linking with TVET institutes), business skills/development trainings (market oriented), technical mentorship, cooperative groups, promotion of indigenous revivable talents for youth/women, self-employment (off-farm activities) and supportive follow-up to host and refugee communities.

comment.narrative: Business development service were provided for a total of 109(56F), including 51(28F) and 58(28F) from refugee and host communities respectively.
